intro: Doona affinis, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Doona affinis is often found growing in rocky or forested areas, thriving in cool, moist environments.
